alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bath, Fleming and northwestern Rowan Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Cynthiana to near Sharpsburg to near Wades Mill. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sharpsburg, Fairview, Pecks Ridge, Flat Creek and Cowan around 710 PM EDT. Owingsville, Craintown, Reynoldsville, Elizaville, Bethel, Nepton and Craigs around 715 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Flemingsburg, Pebble, Sherburne, Oakley, Odessa, Wyoming, Slate Valley, Mount Carmel, Tilton, Hillsboro, Foxport, Grange City, Ringos Mills, Poplar Plains, Goddard, Wallingford, Plummers Landing and Muses Mills. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 126, and between mile markers 143 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
